H0.text: the outer layer of the skin that contains no blood or nerve supply is the. Dermis

H1.text: the outer layer of the skin that contains no blood or nerve supply is the. Stratum Corneum

H2.text: the outer layer of the skin that contains no blood or nerve supply is the. Cuticle

H3.text: the outer layer of the skin that contains no blood or nerve supply is the. epidermis

A4.text: The epidermis itself has no blood supply and is nourished almost exclusively by diffused oxygen from the surrounding air.

A5.text: They are closely associated with cutaneous nerves and seem to be involved in light touch sensation.
